DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Source Site Contract Responsibility Entity Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The entity responsible for the contract of the reporting Tissue Source Site (TSS).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Source Site Contract Responsibility Entity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clinical site that collects and provides patient samples and clinical metadata for research use._A legally binding accord between two or more people that details any and all arrangements regarding a specific situation(s)._A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible._An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: : A wholly-owned subsidiary of Leidos, Inc that develops and applies advanced technologies to help translate research discoveries into treatments for cancer and AIDS.

Concepts.definition: A wholly-owned subsidiary of Leidos, Inc that develops and applies advanced technologies to help translate research discoveries into treatments for cancer and AIDS.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: NCI.  The National Cancer Institute, part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services, is the Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research.  NCI conducts, coordinates, and funds cancer research, training, health information dissemination, and other programs with respect to the cause, diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of cancer.  Access the NCI Web site at http://cancer.gov.

Concepts.definition: The Federal Government's principal agency for cancer research. Part of the National Institutes of Health of the United States Department of Health and Human Services.
